info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 8:43PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Thunderstorms with Heavy Rainfall Moving Northward into Yadkin County... ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...Yadkin County in North Central North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. Small creeks and streams may experience sharp rises. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 840 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving northward into Yadkin County. Yadkin County experienced heavy rainfall earlier this afternoon and evening and additional rainfall will quickly result in excessive runoff and cause flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain fell earlier today and an additional 1 to 2 inches of rainfall is likely during the next 1 to 2 hours. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Beaverdam Creek, Deep Creek, Arnold Branch, Dobbins Creek, Elkin Creek, Haw Branch, East Swan Creek, Hunting Creek, Jonesville Creek, Harmon Creek, Cranberry Creek and Cobb Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elkin... Yadkinville... Jonesville... Boonville... East Bend... Nebo... and Shacktown. - for additional information please go to http://www.weather.gov slash safety slash flood.
info.instruction: Precautionary Statements: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
